alert.note: Alert for Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Chatham. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 417 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated isolated to scattered showers and thunderstorms over the central and eastern portions of Downtown Savannah. As much as 1 to 2 inches of rain have fallen in some areas over the last hour and a half. Minor flooding has been reported in a number of spots across the eastern portions of the city and the risk for minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas will continue as storms slowly weaken. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hutchinson Island, Midtown Savannah, Downtown Savannah, Wilmington Island, Hunter Army Airfield, Thunderbolt, Whitemarsh Island, Savannah Historic District, Isle Of Armstrong, Gordonston, Fernwood, Lepageville, Savannah State University, Fleetwood, Bona Bella, Edgemere, Fairfield and Ridgewood.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
